task.title: Edit Web Access Rights
task.shortdesc: Edit Web access rights for employees assigned to a selected role on the Web Access Rights page.

context.p: Initially, all the UltiPro areas/elements are collapsed and the associated access rights are disabled. Access rights can be assigned to an entire area (and inherited by all elements within the area) or assigned individually to selected elements within an area. When selected elements in an UltiPro area have different access rights than others in the same area, the corresponding rights for the high-level area are shown to be partially enabled.
The available access rights include Add, View, Edit, Delete, and Execute. Assigned access rights for the portal areas/elements are indicated with icons on the Web Access Rights page:

ul.li: Green check marks indicate rights that are enabled.
Unchecked boxes indicate rights that are disabled.
Checkboxes with yellow tick marks indicate rights that are partially enabled.

step.cmd: From the Web Access Rights page, expand the Areas of UltiPro to view the current access rights settings for the associated UltiPro elements.
Assign access rights to each area/element:

ul.li: Check the Add box to enable add rights.
Check the View box to enable view-only rights.
Check the Edit box to enable viewing and editing rights.
Check the Delete box to enable delete rights.
Check the Execute box to enable execute rights.
Uncheck any box to disable the assigned access rights.

step.cmd: Select the Description / Role Types, Standard Reports Access Rights, or Business Rules Access Rights tab to add or change other role information, as desired.

note.p: The Standard Reports Access Rights and Business Rules Access Rights tabs only appear if an appropriate role type is selected on the Description / Role Types page.

step.cmd: Select Save. The Role Administration page appears.
